fields.description: Right now {jiraissues} only lets one pull an issue list.  It is desirable to have a way to pull only the count from JIRA, something like {jiraissuecount}.  This was discussed in the following thread on the Confluence forums: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=6090&tstart=0
fields.summary: Add macro for pulling number of issues from JIRA rather than issue list

fields.description: The ability to merge pages that were edited at the same time would be great.  Most of the time the changes that were made to the pages were in different sections so I end up copying and pasting the changes back into the page and 'overwriting' them.
fields.summary: Merge Feature for Pages that Were Edited at the Same Time

fields.description: It would be nice to have the option in my profile to disable notifications triggered by edits/comments that I made.  In other words, I want to know when others change a page, not when I change a page.
fields.summary: Disable notifications for own edits

fields.description: Daily HTML notification has base Href w/ "confluence" in it. * Other relative links also has "confluence" * * Outlook client works fine w/ this base href but other email client fails. Not sure which client intepret the base href correctly. A possible fix is to strip off the "confluence" in base href to only bare server location and always encode the context in the relative URL(s).
fields.summary: Broken HTML notification for certain email client due to extra "/Confluence" in base href

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/listpages-alphaview.action?key=TEST&startsWith=$action.startsWith&startIndex=30

Quick patch:

Find confluence/pages/listpages-alphaview.vm, and on line70 in:

replace $action.startsWith with $!action.startsWith

Unfortunately, when the RSS feed for blog entries is pulled down it does not contain user information regarding who made the blog post.  Please add the author to the blog items when pulled down via RSS.  Thanks!
fields.summary: RSS feeds of blog entries do not contain username of who posted

fields.description:
Links between pages are case-insensitive, but referring pages don't show up in "Incoming Links" of target-page unless the casing is exactly correct.

Reproducing:

  1. Create page named "Foo"
  2. Create another page, "Bar", with contents "Link to [foo]"
  3. Follow the link
  4. "Bar" is not shown on "Incoming Links" of "Foo"
fields.summary: "Incoming Links" only works for links in correct case

fields.description:
See CONF-1644

When Confluence encounters a corrupt or unreadable confluence.cfg.xml, it just starts the setup process again. This can be at best really annoying, or at worst a serious security problem.

If confluence.cfg.xml is there, but can't be loaded, we should write a good log message describing what went wrong, post a Johnson event and just refuse to start at all.
fields.summary: Handle things better if we get an error loading confluence.cfg.xml

fields.description:
Can we get the ability to export a page, and it's children.

The export space is useful, but often you would like to export a subset of a space, and that's a pain. If export page had the ability to export it's children, in the same interface as export space, this would be a great time save.

Sibling should be CONF-832
fields.summary: Export Page Hierarchy

fields.description:
When I utilize the {content-by-user} macro within a page it shows me pages created by the named user in spaces that I can't see.

Access is prevented by Page names, blog names, and the fact that the Space exists are all information I shouldn't have based on my permissions within Confluence.

Automatic Macros such as this one need to process based on the Groups/Permissions of the current user.
fields.summary: {content-by-user} Macro shows items in Restricted Spaces

fields.description:
"It would be cool if..."

There was a macro that did the equivalent of <meta name="keywords" content="word, some phrase"> to provide hints to the indexer that searches that match those keywords (exactly? case-insensitive? with stemming?) should place that page higher in the search results.

Right now I'm putting a specific phrase in the body of the page, and searching for the phrase with quotes around the phrase does what I want, but when I don't use quotes the page is buried deeper than I would like.  For usability it would be nice if I could artificially raise the placement of a page when a particular phrase is matched even without quotes around the phrase.
fields.summary: Search keyword macro

fields.description:
If the string inside the "code" filter ( {{...}} ) contains a tab character, Confluence doesn't expand the filter properly.

See http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Rh8

for an example.
fields.summary: embedded tab characters break {{code}} filter

fields.description:
The problem is most likely that there isn't a user in scope at the time we render the emails, so there's no way of telling if they have permission to see the link destinations.

Solution: Stick the user to whom the mail is being sent into the AuthenticatedUserThreadLocal for the time it's being rendered, then remove it afterwards.
fields.summary: Emails being sent with links all in red

fields.description:
Right now the thumbnails are stored in with the attachments. This is bad because you can't easily delete all thumbnails, and because you end up backing up generated content.

Move them to something like conf.home/thumbnails
fields.summary: Move thumbnails out of attachments directory

fields.description: We'd like to be able to allow all of the users in our Confluence system to have their own blog.  Right now they can blog on different spaces but we'd prefer to have a personal blog as well.  Additionally, like other blog systems, supporting a category that would be used in filtering search results would be even better.  Categories on spaces don't make a lot of sense, but they definately make sense on presonal blogs.
fields.summary: Support personal blogs and blog categories

fields.description: It would be very useful if Confluence allowed searches to be limited to a particular time domain or user.  For instance, I'd like to see all of the blog posts on a particular space for user Joe Schmo over the last 6 months.
fields.summary: Search by user and date/time range

fields.description:
This is actually for Confluence! But the only available project was JIRA, even from Confluence's JIRA page.

I have several spaces that I manage on my installation. Each is for a different client. I have my web server configured to have a separate URL for each of the clients, so that they have a URL specific to their installation. This is important to give clients a separation between their projects. It's also important on projects where I work as a subcontractor and I can't directly give access to my own company's URL; I have to appear to be working for another company. This is critical for some of my clients.

You can adjust a space to handle different base urls for email, but you can't adjust the base URL for the installation itself. If I have a base URL, regardless of how I configure my web server to point at the installation, the links for things like logout, spaces, etc., always use the base URL for the installation. Just as you can adjust the base URL for email from a space, it would be great (and essential, in my case) if you could adjust the base URL so that in each space, the base URL for the app-wide links like login/logout would change.

Note that I've used the words "project" and "space" interchangeably above.
fields.summary: Allow base url to be specified on a per-project or space basis

fields.description:

fields.summary: Strange behaviour with deactivated users & JIRA user delegation

fields.description:
On a fresh install of Confluence 1.2, the following steps caused the system error (listed below).

1) I Added A New Space, "Test (TEST)"
2) Administration - General Setup: Let anonymous users use Confluence.
3) Space Permissions: Let Anonymous users view space, (I also removed Confluence-Users from the space, but I don't think this matters.) 
4) Clicking on the Rename Page, to rename the "Home" page caused a system error.

I think this problem is related to the "real" problem that I have. I have a backup that causes problems on restore. After restoring, the Confluence Setup Wizard starts every time Tomcat restarts.

Confluence was freshly unzipped with no tables in the database, with a total uptime of 1 minute, 43 seconds!

Jonas

fields.summary: Renaming Home page causes system error

fields.description:
Here is a maybe weird idea:

Looking at the information we harvest in Confluence, I can see various patterns which results in of course various challenges.. ;-)
One of these is the use for short to mid term information storage. Read: The information build up becomes obsolete after a short/medium time. 
A sample scenarios are porjects or pitches. 

During the project, a  lot of information is accumulated. After the project closeout, only very little of the information is ever needed again. We initially though that we simply extract the "relevant" information and remove the rest. However we came to the conclusion that it is very hard or even impossible to define what may be relevant in the future, as we do not know the question yet.
So the other alternative is to leave the information in place and mark it as "outdate" or "obsolete".



The drawback of this approach is that this information then is basically "noise" for most of the users - especially during search.
What I would like to propose is a machanism for supporting a rather simple lifecycle of information in the product:
* it is not there
* it is there and is is current
* it is "retired"

In practice I would envision something like a "retired" or state per page. When this flag is set, 
* the page becomes invisible to regular users 
* the page and it's contents are ignored during searches
* Users have the ability to extend the search to retired pages ("Include retired pages") switch in extended search
* Users have the ability to "make retired pages visible" - a mode switch which may end up in page operations or  space operations or maybe even a candidate for a small toggle to the right of "Profile"
As I guess that most of the mechanisms for implementing this are already in place. (The flag may be wired to the permission system, for example) this may not be to much work.
Question would also be how to deal with links to "retired" pages. Options:
*  Still show them, maybe with a different icon so that this is visible.
** Advantage: No name clashes when pages are made "visible"
** Drawback: The noise is still there
* Don't show them
** Advantage: The noise is gone. 
** Disadavantage: May provoke name-clashes. Question would be whether this is a problem in reality

Currently, we use a different workaround based on permissions (we disable a complete project space, once we're done with that project) - the drawback is that this is 
* very cumbersome (you have to ask for permissions)
* you have no chance in finding it, unless you know "it has been there" So this does not look like a viable solution on the long run.

What do you think?
fields.summary: Support for information lifecycle: "retired pages"

fields.description:
The attachment links generated into the bottom of a page with attachments link explicitly to a certain version of the attachment, even if there is only one version of the attachment.

We've never actually needed the feature of being able to point into a certain version of an attachment but have had more than one occasion where 

1) person A sends url of an attachment with version number to person B
2) person C uploads new version of the attachment over the old version
3) person B unknowingly opens the older attachment and not the latest version

Hence I think it'd be better if the "standard" URL to an attachment didn't actually include the version number at all and maybe add a new "Link to this version" into the listing that has the version number included.
fields.summary: Versioned attachment links are confusing to non-technical users

fields.description:
We need to make it a little more self-consistent. I'm similarly confused by the fact that you do some things on the view screen and some on the edit screen.

Inspired by the following forum post:

"Regarding the new UI for space permissions in 1.2, I find it a bit
unintuitive and inconsistant.
And though the new one is visually nice, I didint think there was a problem
with original one such that it required changing - it was nice and simple
and intuitive .

1) For the permission table, why is Browse not a column heading?
2) Why is some of the permission editing done on the first "View Space
Permissions" page and some done on the "edit permissions" page?

I think there can be a few improvements:

1) View Space Permissions should be just that: viewing.
2) "Browse" should be a column heading for both View and Edit Permissions.
3) Edit Permissions should have the select lists (that are currently on
View)
4) The buttons for the select lists should be called "Add" (rather than
"ok")"
fields.summary: Improve UI for permissions editing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1762].
  {panel}

Internally, we are having discussion how to collaborate "graphically".
Currently, we use attachments of various source types (PPT, Visio, whathaveyou). Once we reach a somewhat stable version, these are exported into jpg/gif which in turn is embedded into the respective page.

It would be very nice, if we could embed objects which are not only bitmaps.
I see these options

1 Render the attachments. Out document management system does this. This is really neat, as you can preview PDF, Doc, PPT without having to launch the application. However this is a dead end collaboration wise.

2 Support additional mime formats, e.g. SVG.
If we can agree on using SVG for illustrations, we can use this for both display and storage. Change to Confluence should be minimal.
2.1 Support in-place editing as described in http://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/SVG_whiteboard or an "etch-a-sketch" Confluence. ;-) This should by 2nd stage.

Bottom line:
* Please provide support for embedded SVG !foo.svg!
* Consider including in place SVG editing, once appropriate browser / applet support is available.

*Workaround*

* Confluence 5.7 new feature named [File preview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Filesarefirstclasscitizens] have the ability to render {{svg}} file. However, Confluence still unable to render it as thumbnail. Hence it is necessary to render the file as a link.
* You can use [SVG out add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.edrup.confluence.plugins.svg-out/server/overview] to view SVG files in confluence pages. Please try it first in a test environment to make sure it does not disrupt your instance.
fields.summary: Embedding of SVG

fields.description:
Don't know if this still happens under 1.2.1 but at least under 1.0.3, the following misbehavior happens. We had a user account with a non-existing email address. When Confluence sends the change notifications to the account, the sending obviously fails during the SMTP handshake. Now, our administrator just noticed Confluence had tried to send a change notification email 11458 times during the last 24 hours - just to this one account. Some other accounts are also similarly getting resends of the change emails.

Since there's no way to tell the problem exists other than noticing an email server is slowing down, I'd prefer someone check the logic for retrying to send a change notification. ;)
fields.summary: Problem sending email notification can cause email flooding

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1732].
  {panel}

Would like the ability to display numbered, formatted headers.  Same test style as existing headers (h1., h2., etc), but with dot-notation nested numbering.

Maybe something like: h#., h##., h###., etc.

So markup like:
h#. One
h##. One-one
h##. One-two
h#. Two
h##. Two-one
h###. Two-one-one

would display as if markup was entered:
h2. 1. One
h3. 1.1 One-one
h3. 1.2 One-two
h2. 2. Two
h3. 2.1 Two-one
h4. 2.1.1 Two-one-one

Notice that the heading levels start at h2 since h1 is really too big for this usage.


{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of January 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi All,

Thank you for your feedback on this issue thus far. We acknowledge that many teams require numbered headings for many cases ranging from specifications to the legal profession. 
At present, this issue is not on our short term roadmap.
Please consider one of the many add-ons in the marketplace which provide this functionality:

  *Cloud and Server*
* [Numbered Headings|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/nl.avisi.confluence.plugins.numberedheadings]

  *Server only*
* [Engineering Essentials|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.precisionplugins.engineeringessentials]
* [Easy Numbered Headings|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.bolo.conf.numhead]

Many users have indicated that they need flexibility in the way this feature should work for them. Please do comment to let us and our add-on vendors know if these add-ons do not provide the functionality which you need.

Confluence Product Management
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-1726].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Unable to create space or page by sending emails to Confluence.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an incoming mail handler in Confluence to ingest incoming emails with options to create space, page or add comments.

h3. Workaround 
None at the moment. 

h3. Additional info
This feature is available in Confluence Server using the add-on [Send EMail to Page Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/biz.artemissoftware.plugins.confluence.send-email-to-page/server/overview]

  at java.lang.ref.Finalizer.access$100(Finalizer.java:14)
  at java.lang.ref.Finalizer$FinalizerThread.run(Finalizer.java:160)

I realize this is only a warning and the document is seemingly being closed by the finalize anyways, but we have a lot of attached pdf documents and these clutter the error log making it difficult to see if there are any "real" exceptions occuring.
fields.summary: PDF Document not closed during re-index

fields.description:
From Email
-------
HI Rueben & Jonathan:

This kind of stuff happens all the time.
Usually when I first load a page with lots of links Confluence botches the job and makes a bunch of addPage links - TO RANDOM PROJECTS.

We have all learned to hit refresh repeatedly until the links all "work". Whenever I last talked to Confluence they mentioned the codehaus install being a bit off (or using a different database or something).  I kind of suspect it just
has a lots of pages & activity. And some shared pool of link resolvers is being hammered and several threads end up using the same link resolver at once.

I will start bug report,
Jody

>Hi. Thanks for the reply. I am pretty sure that this is a confluence bug
>as well. As far as I remember, geotools did not have a "QuickStart"
>page, so the problem likely did not overwrite any of our pages. If the
>QuickStart page is still there by the end of the week, I will remove it.
>
>Rueben
>
>On Sat, 2004-08-21 at 17:43, Jonathan Locke wrote:
>
>>hmm....
>>
>>now that i click on your link it looks like bob did not revert it.
>>
>>the revision history seems to indicate that your QuickStart page
>>now has the history of my page of the same name.  this has got
>>to be a confluence bug!  could you please let people on GEOTOOLS
>>know that's what's up?
>>
>>>To Jonathan Locke,
>>>
>>>Hi. I am a lurker on the Geotools project and noticed that your last
>>>changes to the QuickStart (Wicket) page were saved to the Geotools
>>>pages. See:
>>>
>>>http://docs.codehaus.org/display/GEOTOOLS/QuickStart
>>>
>>>I assume this is some problem with Confluence.
>>>
>>>Rueben
>

fields.description:
PropertySet Lies.

setText and setString are treated identically by the Hibernate PropertySet provider - both are stuffed into the same VARCHAR(255). So when you try to create an excerpt >255ch, the page dies.

We need to either

(a) enforce the 255ch limit more effectively, or
(b) fix PropertySet Hibernate provider, or
(c) use some other mechanism for persisting clobs.
fields.summary: Long excerpts (>255 ch) kills page

If the pdf file is very large, the open process will very slow.

fields.description:
I'm using the External User Mgt in Jira... but here's a confusing thing for users. 

I create a user account in JIRA, assign it confluence-use perms ... but they are sent an email with a [JIRA] Account Created subject line, and go "Whaaaa??? What the heck is Jye-ruh???" And the rest of the email tells them about their swell new Jira account...but no mention of Confluence.

I would think the subject should be configurable at least.

Oh... the email body itself should be configurable too...without having to dig into the templates directory and hack it. ;-)


Cheers,
Timo
fields.summary: Subject/ body on new user email says "JIRA" w/ external mgt.
